loon.ggplot 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • ggplots -> interactive loon plots

Pipe ggplot object

gg_pipe.Rd

Pack a ggplot object forward to loon.ggplot expressions via a pipe-operator "%>%".

gg_pipe(data, ggplotObject)

Arguments

data

a data frame to use for ggplot
ggplotObject

a ggplot object to be passed though

Value

a ggplot evaluate object

Details

When "+" and "%>%" both appear in pipe operations, "%>%" takes the priority of "+",e.g:

mtcars %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, wt, colour = cyl)) + geom_point() %>% loon.ggplot(),

error would occure. The reason is

geom_point() %>% loon.ggplot()

would run before

ggplot(aes(mpg, wt, colour = cyl)) + geom_point().

Hence, we need a function gg_pipe() to pack the ggplot object and force operations happen in order.

Examples

library(magrittr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘magrittr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:testthat’:
#> 
#>     equals, is_less_than, not
g <- mtcars %>%
   gg_pipe(
     ggplot(aes(mpg, wt, colour = cyl)) + geom_point()
   ) %>%
   loon.ggplot()
# NOT RUN {
   # Error
   g <- mtcars %>%
      ggplot(aes(mpg, wt, colour = cyl)) + geom_point()
      %>%
      loon.ggplot()
# }
